H0.text: Pollination is most likely the cause of a plant's discoloration and large brown blotches on its leaves.

H1.text: Photosynthesis is the most likely cause of the plantâ€™s discoloration and large brown blotches on its leaves.

H2.text: Nourishment is the most likely cause of a plant's discoloration and large brown blotches on its leaves.

H3.text: Disease is the most likely cause of a plant that is discolored and has large brown blotches on its leaves.

A4.text: Plant diseases are diseases in plants caused by pathogens (infectious organisms) and environmental conditions (physiological factors).

A5.text: Some slime molds in Phytomyxea cause important diseases, including clubroot in cabbage and its relatives and powdery scab in potatoes.
